Dishes.Name: Chilaquiles
Recipe: 1. Cut the tortillas into small strips and fry them in hot oil until crispy. Set aside on paper towels to drain excess oil.
2. In a separate pan, heat the red or green sauce over medium heat.
3. Add the crispy tortilla strips to the sauce and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring gently until the tortillas soften but remain somewhat crispy.
4. Shred the cooked chicken and add it to the pan with the chilaquiles, mixing it well to combine.
5. Serve the chilaquiles on a plate, topping with a generous sprinkle of cheese, chopped onion, cilantro, and a dollop of sour cream.
6. Optionally, top with a fried egg and slices of avocado for added richness and flavor.

Dishes.Name: Tacos
Ingredients: Choice of meat (beef, pork, chicken, or vegetarian options)
Recipe: 1. Cook the meat of your choice (grill, sauté, or slow-cook until tender).
2. Heat the tortillas on a comal or skillet until warm.
3. Once the meat is ready, slice it into small pieces or shred it (depending on the type of meat).
4. Serve the meat in the warm tortillas.
5. Top with freshly chopped onion, cilantro, a squeeze of lime, and your favorite salsa. Add hot sauce for an extra kick.

Dishes.Name: Sopes
Recipe: 1. Make small, thick tortillas from the corn masa, and heat them on a griddle until lightly golden.
2. Use your fingers to pinch the edges of the tortilla, creating a small border to hold the toppings.
3. Spread a layer of refried beans over the tortilla.
4. Top with shredded lettuce, crumbled queso fresco, sour cream, and salsa.
5. Optionally, add sliced onion for extra flavor.

Dishes.Name: Enchiladas
Recipe: 1. Heat the tortillas in a pan to soften them.
2. Shred the cooked chicken and place a spoonful in the center of each tortilla.
3. Roll the tortillas around the chicken and place them in a baking dish.
4. Pour the red or green enchilada sauce over the rolled tortillas.
5. Sprinkle with cheese and bake at 350°F (175°C) for about 20 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
6. Serve with sour cream, chopped onion, and fresh cilantro on top.

Dishes.Name: Pozole
Recipe: 1. In a large pot, cook the hominy corn with pork or chicken, garlic, and onion. Simmer for several hours until the meat is tender and the flavors are well combined.
2. Prepare toppings: thinly slice cabbage, radishes, and lime.
3. Serve the pozole in bowls and garnish with cabbage, radishes, oregano, and a squeeze of lime.
4. Optionally, add chili powder for extra spice.

Dishes.Name: Tamales
Recipe: 1. Soak the corn husks in warm water to soften.
2. Prepare the masa by mixing it with chicken broth, baking powder, salt, and lard (or butter).
3. Add your choice of meat and sauce to the masa.
4. Spread a thin layer of masa on each corn husk, then fold it into a small packet.
5. Steam the tamales in a large pot for about 1-1.5 hours, or until the masa is fully cooked.

Dishes.Name: Mole Poblano
Recipe: 1. Cook the chicken until tender.
2. Heat the mole sauce in a separate pot, adjusting the consistency with water or chicken broth as needed.
3. Once the chicken is cooked, pour the mole sauce over it and simmer for about 10-15 minutes.
4. Serve with a side of rice and garnish with sesame seeds.

Dishes.Name: Cochinita Pibil
Recipe: 1. Marinate the pork with annatto paste, citrus juice, garlic, salt, and pepper for at least 4 hours (overnight is best).
2. Wrap the marinated pork in banana leaves and bake it in a low oven (around 300°F or 150°C) for about 3-4 hours, or until the pork is tender and shreds easily.
3. Serve with pickled red onions and warm tortillas.

Dishes.Name: Tlayudas
Recipe: 1. Grill the large tortilla until crispy.
2. Top with Oaxacan cheese and cook until melted.
3. Add the meat (grilled or sautéed) and lettuce.
4. Serve with salsa and avocado if desired.

Dishes.Name: Chiles en Nogada
Recipe: 1. Roast the poblano chiles and peel them.
2. Prepare the filling by cooking ground meat and adding fruits (chopped apples, plantains, and peaches).
3. Prepare the walnut sauce by blending walnuts with milk and cinnamon until smooth.
4. Stuff the chiles with the meat and fruit mixture, then cover with the walnut sauce.
5. Garnish with pomegranate seeds and cilantro.

Dishes.Name: Enfrijoladas
Recipe: 1. Heat the black beans until soft and blend into a smooth sauce.
2. Dip the tortillas into the bean sauce and roll them up.
3. Serve with chopped onions, cheese, sour cream, and a drizzle of salsa.

Dishes.Name: Quesadillas
Ingredients: Cheese (queso fresco, Oaxaca, or other melting cheese)
Recipe: 1. Heat a tortilla in a skillet.
2. Add cheese (and optional meat) on top.
3. Fold the tortilla in half and grill until crispy and golden.
4. Serve with salsa and hot sauce.

Dishes.Name: Gorditas
Recipe: 1. Form thick tortillas from the masa.
2. Cook them on a griddle until golden.
3. Cut them in half and stuff them with cheese and meat (if desired).
4. Top with salsa and sour cream.

Dishes.Name: Huaraches
Recipe: 1. Prepare the masa by forming thick oval-shaped tortillas.
2. Grill the tortillas on a hot comal or griddle until lightly golden.
3. Spread refried beans on top of each tortilla.
4. Grill the pork or other meat of your choice (e.g., grilled steak or chorizo) and place it on top of the huaraches.
5. Add grilled cactus (nopal) slices and top with salsa, queso fresco, chopped onion, and cilantro. Serve warm.

Dishes.Name: Pambazos
Recipe: 1. Cook the chorizo with diced potatoes until crispy.
2. Slice the bread and lightly toast it.
3. Dip the bread in a red sauce (made from guajillo chilies) to coat it.
4. Fill the bread with the chorizo and potato mixture.
5. Top with shredded lettuce, sour cream, queso fresco, and salsa. Serve warm.

Dishes.Name: Esquites
Recipe: 1. Boil or grill the corn kernels until tender.
2. In a separate pan, melt butter and mix it with the corn.
3. Stir in a generous amount of mayonnaise.
4. Squeeze lime juice over the corn and add chili powder to taste.
5. Serve in cups, topped with crumbled queso fresco and more chili powder if desired.

Dishes.Name: Elote
Recipe: 1. Grill the corn on the cob until slightly charred.
2. While the corn is still warm, spread a layer of mayonnaise over it.
3. Sprinkle crumbled cotija cheese over the mayonnaise.
4. Dust with chili powder and squeeze fresh lime juice over the top. Serve immediately.

Dishes.Name: Tortas
Recipe: 1. Slice the bolillo rolls and toast them lightly.
2. Grill your meat (such as grilled beef, carnitas, or chicken) and shred or slice it.
3. Spread a layer of refried beans on one side of the roll.
4. Add the grilled meat and top with slices of avocado, lettuce, onion, and salsa. Serve with pickled jalapeños or extra hot sauce if desired.

Dishes.Name: Burritos
Ingredients: Choice of meat (beef, chicken, or pork)
Recipe: 1. Prepare rice and beans (refried or whole).
2. Cook your chosen meat (grilled chicken, beef, or pork).
3. Warm the flour tortillas on a griddle.
4. Layer the rice, beans, grilled meat, guacamole, salsa, and sour cream in the center of the tortilla.
5. Fold the tortilla into a burrito, rolling it tightly to close. Serve with extra salsa or hot sauce on the side.

Dishes.Name: Pasta
Recipe: Mix flour, eggs, and a pinch of salt to make a dough.
Roll it out and cut into desired shapes (spaghetti, fettuccine, etc.).
Boil in salted water until al dente and serve with sauce of choice.

Dishes.Name: Pizza
Recipe: Mix flour, water, yeast, salt, and some olive oil for the dough.
Let the dough rise until it doubles in size.
Roll out the dough, add tomato sauce, mozzarella, and basil.
Bake at 220°C for 10-15 minutes.

Dishes.Name: Ravioli
Recipe: Mix flour and eggs until a smooth dough forms.
Fill with a mixture of ricotta and spinach.
Cook in boiling water and serve with your favorite sauce.

Dishes.Name: Lasagna
Recipe: Sauté meat with onion and garlic, add tomato sauce.
Layer pasta, meat, and bechamel in a dish, top with cheese.
Bake at 180°C for 30-40 minutes.

Dishes.Name: Spaghetti alla Carbonara
Recipe: Cook the pasta.
Sauté the pancetta until crispy.
Mix eggs with grated cheese and pepper.
Toss the egg mixture with hot pasta and pancetta quickly.

Dishes.Name: Risotto
Recipe: Sauté onion in butter, add rice and wine, and cook on low heat, adding broth gradually.
When rice is creamy, add parmesan cheese.

Dishes.Name: Polenta
Recipe: Boil water with salt, add cornmeal slowly, and cook on low heat, stirring.
Add butter and cheese at the end.

Dishes.Name: Ossobuco
Recipe: Brown the meat and set aside.
Sauté the vegetables, add wine, return meat, and cook on low heat with broth until tender.

Dishes.Name: Arancini
Recipe: Form rice balls with cheese in the center.
Coat with egg and breadcrumbs, and fry until golden.

Dishes.Name: Gnocchi
Recipe: Boil potatoes and mash.
Mix with flour and egg to form a dough, cut into small pieces.
Cook in boiling water until they float.

Dishes.Name: Focaccia
Recipe: Mix ingredients and let dough rise.
Spread on a baking tray, sprinkle with rosemary, and bake at 220°C for 20 minutes.

Dishes.Name: Calzone
Recipe: Fill the dough with ingredients, fold and seal edges.
Bake at 200°C until golden.

Dishes.Name: Panzanella
Recipe: Soak the bread in water, squeeze and mix with tomato, cucumber, onion, and basil.
Dress with oil and vinegar.

Dishes.Name: Bruschetta
Recipe: Toast bread, rub with garlic and top with diced tomato, basil, and a drizzle of olive oil.

Dishes.Name: Caprese Salad
Recipe: Alternate slices of tomato and mozzarella, add basil, and drizzle with oil and salt.

Dishes.Name: Tiramisu
Recipe: Dip ladyfingers in coffee, layer with mascarpone, egg, and sugar mixture.
Top with cocoa powder and refrigerate.

Dishes.Name: Panna Cotta
Recipe: Heat cream with sugar and vanilla.
Dissolve gelatin and mix well. Refrigerate until set.

Dishes.Name: Cannoli
Recipe: Form tubes from dough and fry.
Fill with sweetened ricotta, cinnamon, chocolate chunks, and candied fruit.

Dishes.Name: Gelato
Recipe: Mix milk, cream, and sugar; heat.
Add egg yolk and flavoring, and freeze while stirring constantly.

Dishes.Name: Asado
Ingredients: Chimichurri (olive oil, wine vinegar, garlic, parsley, oregano, chili flakes, red bell pepper)
Salsa criolla (1 tomato, 1 onion, 1 red bell pepper, 1 green bell pepper, oil, vinegar)
Recipe: 1. Light the fire with charcoal or wood (preferably quebracho or espinillo) and let it create a good bed of coals.
2. While the grill heats up, season the meat with coarse salt on both sides and let it rest for a few minutes.
3. When the coals are ready, place the meat on the grill, bone side down if applicable, and cook over low heat.
4. Add the sweetbreads, chitterlings, and kidneys, turning them for even cooking.
5. Let the meat cook for 1-2 hours, depending on the cut, until juicy and golden.
6. Meanwhile, prepare the chimichurri and salsa criolla by mixing all ingredients.
7. Serve the asado with the side dishes and enjoy with bread for choripanes.

Dishes.Name: Empanadas
Ingredients: 500 grams of ground beef (preferably shoulder or top round)
1 package of empanada dough for baking (approximately 12 discs)
2 tablespoons of oil (preferably beef fat or neutral oil)
Recipe: 1. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat and add the chopped onions and diced red bell pepper. Sauté until soft.
2. Add the ground beef and cook until browned and fully cooked.
3. Add the paprika, cumin, chili flakes, salt, and pepper to taste. Mix well and cook for a few minutes to blend flavors.
4. Remove from heat and let the mixture cool.
5. Add the chopped hard-boiled eggs and sliced olives to the filling, and mix gently.
6. Preheat the oven to 200°C (392°F).
7. Fill each empanada disc with a spoonful of meat mixture. Moisten the edges with water, fold over, and seal with a fork or by crimping.
8. Place on a baking tray and bake for 20-25 minutes until golden brown.
9. Serve hot.

Dishes.Name: Milanesa
Ingredients: 500 gr Flank or rib steak (churrasco in Spain)
1 tsp Ground chili (replace with 2 crushed dried chili peppers)
Recipe: 1. Season beef or chicken cutlets with salt and pepper.
2. Dip each cutlet in beaten egg, then coat in breadcrumbs.
3. Heat oil in a skillet and fry each cutlet until golden and crispy on both sides.
4. Drain on paper towels and serve with lemon wedges.

Dishes.Name: Locro
Recipe: 1. Soak corn and beans overnight.
2. In a large pot, cook diced beef with chorizo until browned.
3. Add corn, beans, and water, then simmer on low heat for several hours until everything is tender.
4. Season with salt, pepper, and paprika.

Dishes.Name: Humitas
Recipe: 1. Mix grated corn with chopped onions, cheese, salt, and pepper.
2. Spoon mixture into corn husks and fold them closed.
3. Steam for about 30-40 minutes, until filling is set.

Dishes.Name: Choripan
Recipe: 1. Grill the sausage until fully cooked.
2. Place sausage in crusty bread and add chimichurri sauce on top.
3. Serve hot.

Dishes.Name: Matambre
Recipe: 1. Cook the flank steak with vegetables and egg.
2. Roll the steak tightly and tie with string.
3. Boil or bake until tender, then cool, slice, and serve cold.

Dishes.Name: Provoleta
Ingredients: 2 thick wheels (about 8-9 ounces each) of provolone cheese with rind
4 tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil, or as needed
Sea salt or kosher salt, to taste
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
Recipe: 1. Heat a grill or skillet over medium-high heat.
2. Place the provolone cheese wheels on the grill or skillet.
3. Cook until the cheese melts and becomes lightly golden around the edges.
4. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with oregano, salt, and pepper to taste.
5. Serve immediately and enjoy.

Dishes.Name: Alfajores
Ingredients: Shredded coconut or melted chocolate (for coating)
Recipe: 1. Spread dulce de leche between two cookies to form a sandwich.
2. Roll the edges of the sandwich in shredded coconut or dip in melted chocolate.
3. Let it chill until the coating sets, then serve.

Dishes.Name: Dulce de Leche
Ingredients: 1/4 teaspoon of baking soda (optional, for smooth texture)
Recipe: 1. In a large pot, combine the milk and sugar.
2. Cook over medium-low heat, stirring constantly to prevent burning.
3. Continue cooking for 1.5-2 hours, until the mixture thickens and turns a caramel color.
4. If desired, add baking soda towards the end of cooking to achieve a smoother consistency.
5. Let it cool before using as a filling or topping.

Dishes.Name: Pastelitos
Ingredients: 200 grams of butter or vegetable shortening
Recipe: 1. In a large bowl, mix the flour, butter (or shortening), salt, and lemon juice. Add water gradually and knead until a smooth dough forms.
2. In a separate bowl, combine the cornstarch with a little water to create a paste, then add to the dough mixture.
3. Roll out the dough on a lightly floured surface and cut into small squares.
4. Place a piece of quince paste in the center of each square.
5. Fold the dough over the paste and seal the edges tightly.
6. Heat the oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 350°F (175°C).
7. Fry the pastelitos until golden brown, then drain on paper towels.
8. In a small saucepan, combine sugar and water. Heat until sugar dissolves and becomes a syrup.
9. Brush the warm pastelitos with the syrup and sprinkle with colored sprinkles.
10. Serve warm and enjoy!

Dishes.Name: Facturas
Ingredients: 10 g dry baker's yeast or 25 g fresh yeast
Recipe: 1. In a bowl, combine the warm milk and yeast. Let it sit for 5 minutes until the yeast is activated.
2. In a separate large bowl, mix the flour, sugar, salt, and vanilla extract.
3. Add the eggs and activated yeast mixture to the dry ingredients. Mix to form a dough.
4. Knead the dough for about 10 minutes until it becomes smooth and elastic.
5. Add the butter and continue kneading until fully incorporated.
6. Cover the dough with a cloth and let it rise for about 1-2 hours, or until doubled in size.
7. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
8. Once the dough has risen, punch it down and divide it into small portions. Shape into your desired forms (like small buns or twists).
9. Place the shaped dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
10. Bake for about 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown.
11. Let cool slightly, then serve. Optionally, you can dust with powdered sugar or drizzle with icing.

Dishes.Name: Hamburger
Recipe: 1. Mix ground beef with salt and pepper to taste.
2. Shape the mixture into a burger patty.
3. Cook the burger in a skillet or on a grill over medium-high heat until the desired level of doneness.
4. Serve the burger on a hamburger bun with your favorite toppings (lettuce, tomato, onion, cheese, etc.).

Dishes.Name: Fries
Recipe: 1. Peel and cut the potatoes into evenly sized strips.
2. Heat oil in a skillet or deep fryer to 180°C.
3. Fry the potatoes in the hot oil until golden and crispy.
4. Drain the fries on paper towels and season with salt to taste.

Dishes.Name: Pizza
Recipe: 1. Preheat the oven to 220°C.
2. Roll out the pizza dough on a floured flat surface.
3. Top the dough with tomato sauce, mozzarella cheese, and other toppings like pepperoni, ham, or mushrooms.
4. Place the pizza in the oven and bake for 12-15 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the crust is golden.

Dishes.Name: Hot Dog
Recipe: 1. Cook the sausages in hot water or on a grill.
2. Place the cooked sausages inside a hot dog bun.
3. Add mustard, ketchup, onions, or any other sauce or condiment of your choice.

Dishes.Name: Cheeseburger
Recipe: 1. Shape ground beef into a patty and season with salt and pepper.
2. Cook the burger in a skillet or on a grill over medium-high heat.
3. Add a slice of cheddar cheese on top of the meat when it is almost done, allowing it to melt.
4. Serve the burger on a hamburger bun with lettuce, tomato, onion, and your choice of condiments.

Dishes.Name: Mac and Cheese
Recipe: 1. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions.
2. Meanwhile, melt butter in a large skillet and add flour to make a roux.
3. Gradually add milk to the skillet, whisking constantly until the sauce thickens.
4. Stir in shredded cheddar cheese and mix until melted.
5. Add the cooked pasta and mix well until it is fully coated with the cheese sauce.

Dishes.Name: Fried Chicken
Recipe: 1. Season chicken pieces with salt, pepper, and other spices to taste.
2. Dredge the chicken in seasoned flour, ensuring it is well-coated.
3. Heat oil in a deep skillet to 180°C.
4. Fry the chicken in the hot oil until golden and crispy on the outside and cooked through on the inside.
5. Drain the chicken on paper towels before serving.

Dishes.Name: Pancakes
Recipe: 1. In a bowl, mix flour, baking powder, sugar, milk, egg, and melted butter until smooth.
2. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and grease it with a little butter or oil.
3. Pour small amounts of batter onto the hot skillet.
4. Cook each pancake until bubbles appear on the surface, then flip and cook the other side until golden.
5. Serve with maple syrup, fruit, or whipped cream.

Dishes.Name: Waffles
Recipe: 1. Mix flour, baking powder, sugar, egg, milk, and melted butter in a bowl until smooth.
2. Preheat a waffle iron and grease it with a little oil or butter.
3. Pour the batter into the waffle iron and cook according to the device's instructions, until the waffles are golden and crispy.
4. Serve with fruit, maple syrup, or whipped cream.

Dishes.Name: Donuts
Recipe: 1. Mix flour, sugar, yeast, warm milk, egg, and melted butter in a bowl.
2. Knead until smooth and let the dough rise for 1 hour.
3. Roll out the dough and cut it with a donut cutter.
4. Fry the donuts in hot oil until golden on the outside.

Dishes.Name: Apple Pie
Recipe: 1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Peel and slice apples, then mix with sugar, cinnamon, and lemon juice.
3. Roll out pie dough and place in pie dish.
4. Add apple mixture into crust, dot with butter.
5. Cover with top crust, seal edges, and make slits.
6. Bake for 50-60 minutes until golden.

Dishes.Name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
Recipe: 1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Cream together butter, brown sugar, and sugar.
3. Add vanilla extract and egg; mix well.
4. Stir in flour, baking soda, and salt.
5. Fold in chocolate chips.
6. Drop by spoonfuls onto a baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes.

Dishes.Name: Brownies
Recipe: 1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease a baking pan.
2. Melt butter and mix with sugar.
3. Add eggs and vanilla extract.
4. Stir in cocoa powder, flour, salt, and baking powder.
5. Pour into the pan and bake for 20-25 minutes.

Dishes.Name: Ice Cream
Recipe: 1. Mix heavy cream, milk, sugar, vanilla extract, and a pinch of salt in a bowl.
2. Pour mixture into an ice cream maker.
3. Churn according to the manufacturer's instructions until thickened.
4. Freeze for a few hours before serving.

Dishes.Name: Clam Chowder
Recipe: 1. Cook bacon in a pot until crispy; remove and set aside.
2. Sauté onion and celery in the bacon fat.
3. Add butter and flour to make a roux.
4. Pour in milk and cream, stirring to thicken.
5. Add diced potatoes and simmer until tender.
6. Add clams, salt, and pepper, and cook until clams are done.

Dishes.Name: Lobster Roll
Recipe: 1. Mix lobster meat with mayonnaise, celery, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
2. Toast hot dog buns with butter.
3. Fill buns with lobster mixture and serve.

Dishes.Name: BBQ Ribs
Recipe: 1. Preheat oven to 300°F (150°C).
2. Rub ribs with salt, pepper, paprika, and garlic powder.
3. Wrap ribs in foil and bake for 2.5-3 hours.
4. Unwrap ribs, brush with BBQ sauce, and broil for 5-10 minutes.

Dishes.Name: Steak
Recipe: 1. Season steak with salt and pepper.
2. Heat a skillet with butter, garlic, and rosemary.
3. Sear steak on both sides until desired doneness.
4. Let rest for a few minutes before serving.

Dishes.Name: Sushi
Recipe: Cook sushi rice and season with rice vinegar.
Place rice on nori, add fillings (fish, cucumber, avocado), and roll tightly.
Slice into pieces and serve with soy sauce.

Dishes.Name: Ramen
Recipe: Heat broth with soy sauce or miso paste.
Cook noodles separately.
Pour broth over noodles, add sliced pork, boiled egg, and garnish with green onions.

Dishes.Name: Tempura
Recipe: Heat oil.
Dip shrimp or vegetables in tempura batter and fry until golden.
Drain on paper towels and serve with dipping sauce.

Dishes.Name: Udon
Recipe: Cook udon noodles.
Heat dashi broth with soy sauce and add mushrooms.
Pour broth over noodles, add egg and green onions.

Dishes.Name: Soba
Recipe: Cook soba noodles and rinse.
Serve in cold dashi broth, garnish with green onions and nori.

Dishes.Name: Miso Soup
Recipe: Heat dashi broth, dissolve miso paste, add tofu and seaweed.
Garnish with green onions and serve warm.

Dishes.Name: Onigiri
Recipe: Shape rice into triangles, add filling in the center, wrap with nori.
Serve as a snack or meal.

Dishes.Name: Yakitori
Recipe: Skewer chicken pieces, grill while brushing with a sauce made from soy sauce, mirin, and sugar.

Dishes.Name: Gyoza
Recipe: Mix filling ingredients and wrap in gyoza wrappers.
Pan-fry until golden, then steam until cooked.

Dishes.Name: Tonkatsu
Recipe: Coat pork cutlets in flour, egg, and panko.
Fry until golden and crispy.
Serve with tonkatsu sauce.

Dishes.Name: Coq au Vin
Recipe: Brown the chicken pieces in a pan.
Remove and sauté bacon lardons, onion, carrots, and garlic.
Add wine, bouquet garni, and chicken back into the pan.
Simmer for 1.5 hours.
In a separate pan, sauté mushrooms in butter and add to the dish near the end.

Dishes.Name: Ratatouille
Recipe: Slice all vegetables and sauté onion and garlic in olive oil.
Add eggplant, zucchini, and bell pepper, and cook until soft.
Add tomatoes and thyme, and simmer for 30 minutes until vegetables are tender.

Dishes.Name: Boeuf Bourguignon
Recipe: Brown beef in a pan and set aside.
Cook bacon and vegetables in the same pan, then add wine, bouquet garni, and beef.
Simmer for 2-3 hours until the meat is tender.
Add mushrooms and cook for an additional 10 minutes.

Dishes.Name: Quiche Lorraine
Recipe: Cook the bacon and onion until crispy.
Whisk eggs, cream, and seasonings.
Add the bacon mixture and cheese to the pie crust, pour over the egg mixture, and bake at 180°C for 30-35 minutes until set.

Dishes.Name: Crêpes
Recipe: Mix all ingredients into a smooth batter.
Heat a pan and pour in a small amount of batter, swirling it to cover the base.
Cook for 2-3 minutes on each side.
Serve with lemon, sugar, or your choice of fillings.

Dishes.Name: Escargots de Bourgogne
Recipe: Mix butter with garlic, parsley, shallots, wine, salt, and pepper.
Stuff snails with the garlic butter mixture and place in snail shells.
Bake at 180°C for 10-12 minutes.

Dishes.Name: Soupe à l'oignon
Recipe: Caramelize onions in butter.
Add wine and broth, and simmer for 30 minutes.
Toast baguette slices and top with grated cheese.
Ladle soup into bowls, place bread on top, and broil until cheese melts.

Dishes.Name: Tarte Tatin
Recipe: Caramelize sugar and butter in a pan, then add apples and cook until tender.
Top with puff pastry, bake at 200°C for 20-25 minutes, and flip the tart onto a plate.

Dishes.Name: Madeleines
Recipe: Mix ingredients to form a batter.
Spoon batter into madeleine molds and bake at 180°C for 10-12 minutes until golden.

Dishes.Name: Moules Marinières
Recipe: Sauté onion and garlic in butter, add mussels and wine.
Cover and cook until mussels open.
Sprinkle with parsley and season with salt and pepper.

Dishes.Name: Paella
Ingredients: 1 pound of chicken, cut into pieces
Recipe: 1. In a large paella pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
2. Add the chicken and rabbit pieces and brown on all sides.
3. Add the green beans and cook for a few minutes until tender.
4. Stir in the grated tomato and paprika, and cook for another 2 minutes.
5. Add the rice and saffron, ensuring the rice is evenly coated with the oil and seasonings.
6. Pour in the chicken broth and spread the rice evenly in the pan. Do not stir after this point.
7. Cook on medium heat for about 15-20 minutes or until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed.
8. Let the paella rest for 5 minutes, then garnish with lemon wedges before serving.

Dishes.Name: Tortilla Española
Ingredients: 4 large potatoes, peeled and thinly sliced
Recipe: 1. Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan over medium heat.
2. Add the sliced potatoes and onions, and cook until the potatoes are tender but not browned, about 15 minutes.
3. Drain the potatoes and onions, reserving the oil.
4. In a large bowl, beat the eggs and season with salt.
5. Add the potato and onion mixture to the eggs and mix gently.
6. Heat a few tablespoons of the reserved oil in the pan and pour in the egg mixture.
7. Cook on low heat for about 5-7 minutes or until the bottom is golden and set.
8. Flip the tortilla onto a plate and slide it back into the pan to cook the other side for an additional 3-4 minutes.
9. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Dishes.Name: Gazpacho
Ingredients: 1 slice of stale bread, soaked in water (optional)
Recipe: 1. In a blender, combine the tomatoes, cucumber, bell pepper, garlic, and soaked bread if using.
2. Blend until smooth and gradually add olive oil and vinegar.
3. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
4. Add cold water to achieve the desired consistency.
5. Chill in the refrigerator for at least an hour before serving.
6. Serve cold with a drizzle of olive oil and optional garnish of chopped vegetables or croutons.

Dishes.Name: Jamón Ibérico
Recipe: 1. Ensure the Jamón Ibérico is at room temperature before serving to enhance its flavor.
2. Slice the jamón thinly using a sharp knife, cutting at an angle for the best texture.
3. Serve the slices on a wooden board or plate.
4. Accompany with breadsticks or slices of crusty bread, if desired.

Dishes.Name: Chorizo
Ingredients: 1 pound of chorizo sausage (Spanish or Mexican, depending on your preference)
1/2 teaspoon of smoked paprika (optional for extra flavor)
Recipe: 1. Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. If using, add the minced garlic and sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
2. Slice the chorizo sausages into 1/4-inch thick rounds. If you prefer, you can remove the casing and crumble the sausage instead.

3. Add the chorizo slices to the pan and cook for 5-7 minutes, turning occasionally, until the chorizo is browned and crispy around the edges. If you like, sprinkle in smoked paprika for an added depth of flavor during the cooking process.
4. Once cooked, remove the chorizo from the pan and place on a plate lined with paper towels to drain any excess oil.

5. Serve the chorizo warm as a tapa, part of a larger Spanish or Mexican meal, or on top of a salad. Garnish with freshly chopped parsley and serve with lemon wedges on the side for an added zesty kick.

Dishes.Name: Churros
Recipe: 1. In a saucepan, combine the water, butter, sugar, and salt, and bring to a boil.
2. Remove from heat and add the flour all at once, stirring until a dough forms.
3. Transfer the dough to a piping bag fitted with a star tip.
4. Heat oil in a deep pan over medium-high heat.
5. Pipe the dough into the hot oil in 4-inch strips and fry until golden brown.
6. Remove and drain on paper towels.
7. Toss the churros in a mixture of sugar and cinnamon before serving.

Dishes.Name: Cocido Madrileño
Ingredients: 1 cup of dried chickpeas, soaked overnight
Recipe: 1. In a large pot, add the soaked chickpeas, pork, beef, and chicken, and cover with water.
2. Bring to a boil, skimming off any foam that rises.
3. Lower the heat and simmer for 1 hour.
4. Add the chorizo, morcilla, carrots, potatoes, and cabbage.
5. Cook for another hour or until everything is tender.
6. Serve the broth as a first course, followed by the meats and vegetables on a separate platter.

Dishes.Name: Fabada Asturiana
Ingredients: 1 cup of fabada beans, soaked overnight
Recipe: 1. In a large pot, place the soaked beans, chorizo, morcilla, and pancetta.
2. Cover with water and bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer.
3. Add the paprika and saffron, and cook for 2-3 hours or until the beans are tender.
4. Adjust seasoning with salt and serve hot with bread.

Dishes.Name: Pulpo a la Gallega
Recipe: 1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and add the octopus.
2. Cook for about 40-50 minutes or until tender.
3. In a separate pot, boil the potato slices until tender and arrange them on a serving dish.
4. Slice the cooked octopus and place on top of the potatoes.
5. Drizzle with olive oil, sprinkle with paprika, and season with salt before serving.

Dishes.Name: Gambas al Ajillo
Ingredients: 1/2 pound of shrimp, peeled and deveined
Recipe: 1. Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
2. Add the garlic and chili pepper and cook until fragrant.
3. Add the shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes until pink and fully cooked.
4. Sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve immediately with crusty bread.

Dishes.Name: Chicken Tikka Masala
Recipe: Marinate chicken in yogurt, garlic, ginger, and spices.
Grill until cooked.
Simmer in tomato cream sauce and serve.

Dishes.Name: Naan Bread
Recipe: Mix yeast with sugar and warm water.
Combine with flour and salt, knead, and let rise.
Roll into circles and cook in a hot pan with ghee.

Dishes.Name: Samosas
Recipe: Cook spiced potatoes and peas.
Wrap in dough made from flour, salt, and water.
Fry until golden.

Dishes.Name: Biryani
Recipe: Layer marinated meat with saffron rice, spices, and nuts.
Cook under low heat until done.

Dishes.Name: Butter Chicken
Recipe: Cook chicken with spices, garlic, and ginger.
Add tomatoes and cream, simmer until thick.

Dishes.Name: Tandoori Chicken
Recipe: Marinate chicken in spiced yogurt mix.
Grill until charred.

Dishes.Name: Palak Paneer
Recipe: Cook spinach with tomatoes, spices, and garlic.
Add paneer and cream, heat through.

Dishes.Name: Dal Makhani
Recipe: Simmer lentils and beans with spices and tomatoes.
Finish with cream and butter.

Dishes.Name: Chana Masala
Recipe: Cook chickpeas with onions, tomatoes, spices, and herbs until flavorful.

Dishes.Name: Vada Pav
Recipe: Make spiced potato patties, coat in gram flour batter and fry.
Serve in a bun with chutney.

Dishes.Name: Peking Duck
Recipe: Marinate the duck with spices and hoisin sauce.
Roast the duck in the oven until the skin is crispy.
Slice the duck and serve with pancakes, hoisin sauce, scallions, and cucumber slices.
Wrap each slice of duck with sauce and vegetables in a pancake.

Dishes.Name: Dim Sum
Recipe: Mix ground pork, shrimp, ginger, soy sauce, and green onions.
Place a small amount of filling in each wonton wrapper and seal.
Steam the dim sum for about 10 minutes.
Serve with soy sauce or chili oil on the side.

Dishes.Name: Noodles
Recipe: Boil the noodles until tender and drain.
In a pan, sauté ginger, garlic, and green onions in sesame oil.
Add the noodles and soy sauce to the pan and stir-fry.
Optionally, add vegetables like bell peppers or broccoli. Serve hot.

Dishes.Name: Fried Rice
Recipe: In a pan, scramble the egg and set aside.
Sauté garlic, peas, carrots, and green onions.
Add the rice to the pan and stir-fry with soy sauce.
Mix in the scrambled egg and serve hot.

Dishes.Name: Spring Rolls
Recipe: In a pan, cook ground pork if using, then add cabbage, carrots, and bamboo shoots.
Add soy sauce and cook until vegetables are tender.
Place filling in spring roll wrappers, roll tightly, and seal.
Fry in oil until crispy and golden. Serve with dipping sauce.

Dishes.Name: Dumplings
Recipe: Combine ground pork, ginger, garlic, soy sauce, and green onions.
Place a small amount of filling in each dumpling wrapper and seal tightly.
Steam or boil the dumplings until cooked through. Serve with soy sauce or vinegar.

Dishes.Name: Sweet and Sour Pork
Recipe: Cut pork into pieces and fry until crispy.
In a pan, mix vinegar, sugar, and ketchup to make the sweet and sour sauce.
Add bell peppers, onions, and pineapple to the pan and stir-fry.
Toss the fried pork in the sauce and serve hot.

Dishes.Name: Kung Pao Chicken
Recipe: Marinate chicken in soy sauce and vinegar.
Stir-fry chili peppers and garlic in a pan, then add chicken and cook until browned.
Add bell peppers and peanuts, stir-fry until everything is well combined. Serve hot.

Dishes.Name: Mapo Tofu
Recipe: Sauté garlic and ginger in a pan.
Add ground pork and cook until browned.
Add chili bean paste and soy sauce, then gently fold in tofu cubes.
Simmer until flavors are combined. Garnish with green onions and serve.

Dishes.Name: Chow Mein
Recipe: Boil noodles until just tender, then drain.
Stir-fry garlic, bell peppers, carrots, and green onions in sesame oil.
Add the noodles and soy sauce to the pan, stir-frying until combined. Serve hot.

Dishes.Name: Moussaka
Recipe: Slice eggplants and potatoes; fry and set aside.
Sauté onion and garlic, add meat, then tomato sauce, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, and pepper. Simmer.
For béchamel, melt butter, stir in flour, gradually add milk.
Layer potatoes, eggplants, meat in a dish; top with béchamel.
Bake at 180°C for 30-40 minutes.

Dishes.Name: Gyros
Recipe: Marinate meat with olive oil, oregano, thyme, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Grill or pan-fry until cooked.
Serve in pita bread with tomato, onion, and tzatziki sauce.

Dishes.Name: Souvlaki
Recipe: Marinate meat with olive oil, oregano, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Skewer the meat and grill until cooked through.
Serve with pita bread and tzatziki.

Dishes.Name: Greek Salad
Recipe: Chop cucumber, tomatoes, onion, and bell pepper.
Toss with olives, olive oil, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Top with feta cheese cubes.

Dishes.Name: Tzatziki
Recipe: Mix grated cucumber with yogurt, garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, and dill.
Season with salt and pepper.
Chill before serving.

Dishes.Name: Dolmades
Recipe: Sauté onion in olive oil.
Mix with rice, lemon juice, salt, pepper, mint, and dill.
Place a small amount on each grape leaf, roll up, and steam until rice is cooked.

Dishes.Name: Spanakopita
Recipe: Sauté onion in olive oil, add spinach until wilted.
Mix with feta, egg, salt, and pepper.
Layer phyllo sheets, brushing with butter, add filling, top with more phyllo.
Bake at 180°C until golden.

Dishes.Name: Baklava
Recipe: Chop nuts and mix with cinnamon.
Layer phyllo sheets in a pan, brushing each with butter, sprinkle nut mixture.
Bake at 180°C.
Boil honey, sugar, water, lemon juice for syrup; pour over baklava.

Dishes.Name: Loukoumades
Recipe: Mix flour, sugar, yeast, and water to make a dough; let rise.
Fry spoonfuls of dough until golden.
Drizzle with honey and sprinkle with cinnamon.
